sen.j: 新田辺駅（しんたなべえき）は、京都府京田辺市にある、近畿日本鉄道近鉄京都線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Shin-Tanabe Station is a Kintetsu Kyoto Line station located in Kyotanabe City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Shin-Tanabe Station is a Kintetsu Kyoto Line station located in Kyotanabe City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Shin-Tanabe Station, located in Kyotanabe City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line of Kintetsu Railways.
sen.cmt: 表現を他ファイルと統一しました。

tit.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: プラットホーム形状と配置2面4線の橋上駅。
sen.e: Form and Layout of platforms: Shin-Tanabe Station is a two-story station with two platforms and four lines.
Shin-Tanabe Station is a two-story facility with two platforms and four lines.
Shin-Tanabe Station is an aboveground station with two island platforms serving four tracks, with the station house being on the bridge.
sen.cmt: 一部表現を修正しました。

sen.j: ホーム有効長は6両。
sen.e: The platforms each have an effective length for six train cars combined together.
Each platform has a length sufficient to accommodate six cars.
Each platform has a length sufficient to accommodate six cars.

sen.j: 橋上駅を有している。
sen.e: The station has platforms on the second floor.
The station has platforms on the second floor.
The station building is located on the bridge.
sen.cmt: 原文wikiを参照すると、橋上駅舎とありますので、station building としました。

sen.j: 改札口は1ヶ所のみ。
sen.e: There is only one ticket gate to the station.
There is only one ticket gate to the station.
There is only one ticket gate to the station.

sen.j: 東西に出入口があり、西側は駅ビルを併設している。
sen.e: Entrances are on the east and west sides of the station and there is a station building on the west side.
Entrances are on the east and west sides of the station, and there is a station building on the west side.
Entrances are on the east and west sides of the station, and there is a station building on the west side.

sen.j: なお特急券・定期券とも購入が可能である。
sen.e: Limited express tickets and commuter tickets are sold at the station.
Limited express tickets and commuter tickets are sold at the station.
Limited express tickets and commuter tickets are sold at the station.

sen.j: また自動改札機は東芝製が設置されており、赤い自動改札機（EG-2000）は出場時2枚一括処理、PiTaPa・ICOCAに対応する。
sen.e: Of the automatic ticket checkers installed at the station, which are made by Toshiba, red ticket checkers (EG-2000) are able to process two types of tickets together when a passenger exits through the gate.

Of the automatic ticket checkers installed at the station, which were manufactured by Toshiba, the red ticket checkers (EG-2000) are able to process two types of tickets together when a passenger exits the gate.
The automatic ticket gates were manufactured by Toshiba; the red automatic ticket gate (EG-2000) can treat two tickets collectively when exiting, and it accepts PiTaPa/ICOCA cards.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 準急（ラッシュ時のみ運転）と京都市営地下鉄烏丸線乗り入れの普通列車（早朝の近鉄宮津発国際会館駅行1本を除く）はこの駅が始発となる。
sen.e: Semi-express trains (operated only during rush hours) and local trains running on the line that connects with the Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line (excluding one early morning train that leaves Kintetsu-Miyazu Station for Kokusaikaikan Station) start from Shin-Tanabe Station.

The semi-express trains (operated only during rush hours) and local trains running on the line that connects with the Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line (excluding an early morning train that leaves Kintetsu-Miyazu Station for Kokusaikaikan Station) start from Shin-Tanabe Station.

The semi-express trains (operated only during rush hours) and local trains running on the line that connect with the Kyoto Municipal Subway Karasuma Line (excluding an early morning train that leaves Kintetsu-Miyazu Station for Kokusaikaikan Station) start from Shin-Tanabe Station.
sen.cmt: connets→ connect city→ municipal としました。

sen.j: 利用状況
sen.e: Utilization by passengers
Passenger usage statistics
Passenger use
sen.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 2005年11月8日の調査結果によると、1日の利用客は26,625人。
sen.e: According to a survey conducted on November 8, 2005, 26,625 passengers were using Shin-Tanabe Station per day.
According to a survey conducted on November 8, 2005, 26,625 passengers used Shin-Tanabe Station that day.
According to a survey conducted on November 8, 2005, 26,625 passengers used Shin-Tanabe Station that day.

sen.j: 近鉄の全調査対象駅（323駅、但し調査当時の数）中、25位。
sen.e: The station ranked 25th among all Kintetsu stations targeted by the survey (323 stations at the time of the survey) in terms of the number of passengers.
The station ranked twenty-fifth among all Kintetsu stations targeted by the survey (323 stations at the time of the survey) in terms of the number of passengers.
The station ranked twenty-fifth among all Kintetsu stations targeted by the survey (323 stations at the time of the survey) in terms of the number of passengers.

sen.j: 京都線の駅（26駅、大和西大寺駅含む）の中では、6位。
sen.e: It ranked 6th among all stations on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line (26 stations, including Yamato-Saidaiji Station).
It ranked sixth among all stations on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line (26 stations, including Yamato-Saidaiji Station).
It ranked sixth among all stations on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line (twenty-six stations, including Yamato-Saidaiji Station).
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 京都府内の近鉄の駅（23駅）の中では、4位。
sen.e: It ranked 4th among Kintetsu stations located in Kyoto Prefecture (23 stations).
It ranked fourth among the Kintetsu stations located in Kyoto Prefecture (23 stations).
It ranked fourth among the Kintetsu stations located in Kyoto Prefecture (twenty-three stations).
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 松井山手地区や大阪府枚方市東部との連絡地でもあり朝、夕は比較的混雑する。
sen.e: Shin-Tanabe Station, which provides connections to the Matsuiyamate District and the eastern part of Hirakata City, Osaka Prefecture, gets fairly crowded in the evening.
Shin-Tanabe Station, which provides connections to the Matsuiyamate District and the eastern part of Hirakata City, Osaka Prefecture, gets fairly crowded in the evening.
Shin-Tanabe Station, which provides connections to the Matsuiyamate District and the eastern part of Hirakata City, Osaka Prefecture, gets fairly crowded in the morning and evening.
sen.cmt: 朝 を追加しました。

sen.e: Kyotanabe Station on the Katamachi Line of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West) is about five minutes walk from Shin-Tanabe Station.
Kyotanabe Station, on the Katamachi Line of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West), is approximately five minutes on foot from Shin-Tanabe Station.
Kyotanabe Station, on the Katamachi Line of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West), is approximately five minutes on foot from Shin-Tanabe Station.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）11月3日 奈良電気鉄道桃山御陵前駅～西大寺（現・大和西大寺駅）間開通時に開業。
sen.e: Shin-Tanabe Station opened on November 3, 1928, when the train service in the Nara Electric Railway line section between Momoyamagoryomae Station and Saidaiji Station (currently, Yamato-Saidaiji Station) started.

Shin-Tanabe Station opened on November 3, 1928, when the train service on the Nara Electric Railway line section between Momoyamagoryomae Station and Saidaiji Station (currently, Yamato-Saidaiji Station) was launched.
November 3, 1928: The station opened as a station of Nara Electric Railway when the line between Momoyamagoryomae Station and Saidaiji Station (the present-day Yamato-Saidaiji Station) was opened.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。日付表記変更。

sen.j: 1963年（昭和38年）10月1日 会社合併により近畿日本鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: On October 1, 1963, the station became a Kinki Japan Railway station as a result of a company merger.
On October 1, 1963, the station became a Kinki Japan Railway facility due to a company merger.
October 1, 1963: The station became one of the stations of Kintetsu Railways due to the amalgamation that occurred.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。日付表記変更。

sen.j: 1988年（昭和63年）10月9日 橋上駅舎となる。
sen.e: On October 9, 1988, the station was rebuilt as a two-story station.
On October 9, 1988, the station was rebuilt as a two-story structure.
October 9, 1988: The station house was rebuilt on the bridge.
sen.cmt: 橋上駅舎→station house on the bridge としました。日付表記変更。

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）4月1日 PiTaPa使用開始。
sen.e: On April 1, 2007, PiTaPa cards started to be used.
On April 1, 2007, PiTaPa cards came into use.
April 1, 2007: PiTaPa cards came into use.

sen.j: 興戸駅、三山木駅と並んで同志社大学・同志社女子大学生の下宿が多い地域のため、比較的発展した地域である。
sen.e: As with Kodo Station and Miyamaki Station, the area around the station, where many lodgings for the students of Doshisha University and Doshisha Women's College of Liberal Arts are found, is relatively well developed,

As with Kodo Station and Miyamaki Station, the area around the facility, where lodgings for the students of Doshisha University and Doshisha Women's College of Liberal Arts are found, is relatively well developed.
